Posts.Content: I am not very happy with the performance either. I am now four months passing the surgery. Initially, the doc put me on three times a week cialis treatment which I found does not help much because I get semi erection without it as well. Never full even with cialis. Now the doc put me on cialis daily routine. I really hope that it will help me in long term. Yes, i think we all feel depressed sometime when you think about BEFORE and AFTER, but I try to not think about it. I have not tried any other methods yet. Still doing some research. Yep, don't give up.
Posts.Signature: BD, 1962 Late October 2015 Annual physical revealed PSA 6.5 (Was told previous years all under 3.6) Dec 2015 PSA test with Urologist - 8.5 Biopsy Jan 2016 12 cores, 3 positive, 2 on the left and one on the right Left middle 4+3 = 7, 50% Left Lat Middle 3+3 =6, 5% Right Apex 3+4 = 7, 40% Robotic Surgery March 2016 Upgraded Gleason Score 8 (5+3), involving approximately 15% on the left prostate lobe Gleason Score 7 (3+4), involving approximately 5% of the right prostate lobe Left Base Margin Focally Positive for Malignancy Two Lymph nodes with no evidence of metastatic carcinoma (0/2) PSA <0.01 July 2016
Posts.Title: ED depression,

Posts.Content: My U dr prescribed daily Cialis for whole year and he said it will help ED. Since my insurance only pays 6 pills a month, my dr sent me to a pharmacy which makes generic Cialis compound. I think it works as good as the original pill. I think I am getting better in that area. By the way, the Cialis compound costs $50 for 30 days supply which is not bad. If anyone needs the contract info for the pharmacy, please let me know.

Posts.Title: 3 month post-op follow up

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by ASAdvocate Pacer1, Can you post some additional information from your biopsy pathology report here, as you see in members' signatures? Also, be sure to check out the "stickies" at the top of this menu. Prostate cancer is usually slow growing, and, depending on your report, you may have considerable time to research and ponder your course of action. Good luck to you. ---------------------------------- The dr called me this past Thursady and only mentioned a few things and asked me to schedule a consultation next week. I will have discussion with my dr on Monday and should know more details of my biopsy report then. I will post more details next week. Thank you

Posts.Title: Need da Vinci surgeon from Dallas Fort Worth Area

Posts.Content: Hi, Everyone, I would like to know if anyone is from Dallas Fort Worth Area that can recommend an experience doctor perform robotic surgery. Thanks very much.
Posts.Title: Need da Vinci surgeon from Dallas Fort Worth Area

Posts.Content: Thanks, SeaCock for the info I found a dr in UTSouthwestern Medical Center in Dallas who had over 1200 surgery done mentioned in his profile, I made appt with him, but it is not until April. I am afraid it may be take too long to get to treatment. I like to get it done as soon as possible. My current dr is also very engaged in robotic surgery, but I have not got a chance to ask him about the number yet. Thanks.
Posts.Title: Need da Vinci surgeon from Dallas Fort Worth Area

Posts.Content: Thanks HighlanderCFH I have not got details on my results, just got notified by the dr over the phone that 3 of 12 cores are positive. A consultation is scheduled for the coming Monday. He did mentioned surgery over the phone. But he said no additional test is necessary. The PSA level was under 3.6 in 2014 per my family doctor, and it was 6.5 in October 2015 noted in annual exam, Second PSA test by Urologist returned over 8. Biopsy was done in late January. Age 53.

Posts.Content: Initial diagnosis could be very stressful time, I spent everyday looking through internet. This forum is very helpful. My first urologist recommended surgery, so as the second one and third one. I also consulted with a Radiologist who of course recommended radiation treatment. Gleason rating after surgery could be different, my rating was downgraded to 8 (5+3) from 7 (4+3), it was considered as aggressive than expected.
